intro: Chirita poilanei, commonly known as the Polianei's violet, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of delicate, violet-colored flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires consistent moisture and indirect sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
